caption: Beautiful church located in the Latin Quarter of Paris very close to the Cathedral of Notre-Dame. Beautiful architecture both inside and outside. It is a Roman Catholic Church originally started in 1230 and rebuilt and enlarged. The art and statues inside are beautiful. We loved our visit and highly recommend visiting.

Super beautiful church. Stopped off here by chance and was so blown away by it's extraordinary beauty. The stained glass windows are so beautiful. Normally I don't take photos inside churches out of respect but there was few people around. There is an absolutely beautiful garden at the side of the church that's just so peaceful. Stayed around for the mass which was lovely

A small church in the Latin Quarter but surprisingly beautiful inside. The stained glass windows are so exceptional that I dared to take some photos of them. Just look at the attached pictures. As I think you will visit le Quartier Latin et la Rive Gauche , don't miss it.

Beautiful Church of Saint-Severin nearby the Notre Dame Cathedral. Opened to all visitors, make sure to close the door when enter or exit as the church might be in service at the moment. Beautiful glass windows. There are several sections, each dedicated to a Saint. It is a blessing to visit and pray while listening to the organ.

The Church of Saint-Séverin in Paris is a stunning example of Gothic architecture, with its intricate stained glass windows and serene atmosphere. It’s a must-visit for anyone exploring the Latin Quarter.
We wondered at this beautiful church! A peaceful walk around it admiring its details will fill you with awe!

Ig: @oursceneos  The Church of Saint-Séverin, completed in the late 14th century, stands as a magnificent example of Gothic art in the heart of the Latin Quarter, a vibrant and lively area of Paris. This architectural gem, with its intricate stonework, soaring spires, and detailed stained glass windows, offers a glimpse into the craftsmanship and artistic vision of medieval builders. Nestled among bustling streets filled with scholars, students, and travelers, Saint-Séverin not only serves as a place of worship but also as a timeless monument to the cultural and intellectual life that has flourished in the area for centuries. Its grandeur continues to captivate visitors, drawing them into a world where history, art, and faith intertwine harmoniously, making it a must-visit destination for those exploring the rich heritage of the Latin Quarter.

One of the most beautiful churches in Paris, even though it is close to Notre Dame de Paris, which is the most beautiful of them all, at least from an outside point of view. This place was so beautiful that i wanted to stay for the Holy Mass.  The place is open to the public, you don't need to pay anything, but you're open to contribute.

Don’t have to be religious type to enjoy the beautiful architecture, design, and stained glass displays. The inside is essentially a work of art. Worth a quick stop in to see the works from the inside. Beautiful stained glass! Spent more time looking than taking pictures.

Very beautiful 12th century Roman Gothic church. Not a lot of crowds. The stained glass, dated about 1378, the art and sculptures inside and out. The Grand Organ is something to behold. This is not only a place of worship but a place of beauty. I love how the light plays a big part in the interior. It seems to transport one to a different century, surrounded with the beautiful architecture, this is one place not to miss and one to experience.

A true masterpiece of stained glass art. It is definitely worth to visit this church and spend some time on prayer and reflection. The entrance is free and the doors are usually open during the day. One of my favorite churches in Paris.

The Church of Saint-Séverin is a Roman Catholic church in the 5th arrondissement or Latin Quarter of Paris, on the busy tourist street Rue Saint-Séverin. It is one of the oldest churches. It was built at the beginning of 1230, and then, after a fire, it was rebuilt between the 15th and 17th centuries in the Gothic style.
Beautiful church that exudes warmth and community.  So glad we stopped by and rested our feet and said a few prayers for family members.
Ridiculously underrated. It has incredibly gorgeous stained glass and it’s much quieter and less crowded than some bigger churches in Paris. Definitely one of my favorite churches ever.

Amazing ancient active Catholic Church located in the Latin Quarter of Paris. Beautiful interior with amazing stained-glass windows.  Not as lofty as some other Paris churches, which adds to a more intimate feeling.  Wheelchair accessible, but there are no signs indicating that.  Wheeled access is through a small door at the rear of the church off Rue Saint Jacques close to the intersection with Rue Saint Severin.

Church over a thousand years old. Amazing to just be in something that’s existed through so much history. Simple factoid: The pillars inside reflect the various historical architectural periods. And easy must-see close to other must-sees.
The cathedral is one of my favourite in Paris! It’s always quiet and peaceful. Hidden gem you should not miss it.

This church has amazing stained glass windows, some are biblical or historical scenes but some are abstract. These combine beautifully with the stone columns, arches and ceilings. There's a quiet Chapel where you can sit. Highly recommended.
Amazing church, so pretty and intriguing!
A beautiful church. I loved the Gothic style, beautiful stained glass windows but the latest renovations of the windows do not match the old.   There is no entrance fee..
Amazing church. Must see

It's impossible to step into he same church twice. The experience is always different as light piercing the elaborate stained glass covers the interior with colored shadows that change slowly especially during the low Sun days Winter. It's the heart of the most crowded section of the city yet there are too few people inside. Don't make that mistake.

This church is one of my favourite in Paris! It’s always quiet and peaceful. I love the modern art on the stained glass windows. Come in the afternoon where you can see the sun shining through the various colours of the stained glass windows! Absolutely beautiful!

This gothic cathedral is often overlooked due to its proximity to Notre Dame.  This location with its vaulted ceilings, separate alcoves, stunning stained glass, and frescoes and other artwork literally everywhere makes this place another required adventure.
It needs work. Went there many years ago for a concert of Bach Brandenburg concertos. But it looks very old and tired now. Could do with a cleaning and some lighting. Very sad

I have been to Paris/France 3 times and was blessed to stop by this beautiful church each time. And last visit, we were able to see and touch St Maria Faustina Kowalska’s relic! I did not even know it was in the church! God is good!
Quiet, solemn, beautiful architecture. A lovely place to visit and reflect.
Amazing stonework, gorgeous stained glass. A true work of art  not to be missed! Stop, and "feed your soul"

This place is a nice pitspot 🚏 on your next trip to Paris! 🇫🇷 Church of Saint-Severin ⛪ is a nice historical landmark 🏛️ you can explore. The architecture and design is amazing! I wish there was more to do here!

Masterpiece of Gothic Art, a glimpse of "Old" France. Founded in 5th century AD, yet tranquil and relatively free of tourists (and believers).  Strongly recommended for those wanting to see how France used to be...
being here felt as it may have centuries ago… less the asylum seekers, the poor and homeless…this church is amazing. I’m not religious , just appreciative. Actually , more mesmerized to be in Paris

Beautiful Gothic church. A lot of works of art,  sculptures,  triptychs, altars. 😊 Modern abstract colorful stain glass windows make it worth to visit as well. You will not find something like that anywhere else. 😍 Mysterious. Innovative. …
A beautiful serene place in Paris. Masses on Sundays and Fridays are available.

The most beautiful church in Paris. It's magnificent, subtle, mysterious, even a bit dangerous, but in an awe-inspiring way. The place where you want to stay for another 10-15 mins, just sitting there and breathing it in, observing it, feeling grateful for the beauty... Can't really explain why I'm so attracted to it and mesmerised by, but it is definitely one thing I'll for sure remember Paris by (considering other places a bit overrated).
A treasure to see a beautiful cathedral of the past without the crowds lessening the experience. Quiet and contemplative joy to experience
Hidden gem ,like a mini Notre dame ,beautiful inside ,I can see it from my hotel room across the street.

Paris needs to upkeep this chapel its wonderful and has the oldest bell in the city. It's a shame to see it in this state. But overall the visit was very peaceful as not so many people visit this site. The Solomonic column near the altar is eye candy. Honestly it's a hidden gem and i fell in love with it

This church is incredibly special to me. My wife and I visited and we were overcome by the beauty and sanctity of this holy church. At the time, someone was playing a mandolin in a side room and the beautiful music was heard throughout the entire church because if its amazing acoustics. Thinking about the history and the hard work that the saints went through to build this marvel was inspiring.
